intro: Chilita candida, commonly known as the white chilita, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Chilita candida is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
